reviews.name: Gera Encinas Bloch
reviews.comment: Being one of the oldest plazas of Dallas, it’s elegant and full of history.Picnic areaThere are green areas where on could sit down.

reviews.name: Cee Dupree
reviews.comment: Small park, tons of shade to protect you from the Texas heat. Nice views of the large Hyatt Hotel and the reunion tower. No big open grass areas. Pet friendly and clean. +2

reviews.name: Mister Jon
reviews.comment: A nice small park on the edge or downtown. There is a fountain and some benches. Note: there really is not any flat area for ball games. This is more of a park that just has some green area in the middle of an urban setting. +2

reviews.name: Teresa G Leon
reviews.comment: Ferris Plaza is a small but peaceful green space in downtown Dallas, great for a quick break or enjoying the city views near Union Station.

reviews.name: Chelsea Turnbull
reviews.comment: We had a great time visiting Dallas. The city is beautiful and so rich with history! Every turn was unique and interesting. I can't wait to visit again!

reviews.name: Marvel Marvin
reviews.comment: Tourists come here thinkin’ they’ll see a few buildings and leave. But what they get is a whole feelin’. That’s Dallas for ya—big heart, big sky, big welcome.

reviews.name: Osvaldo Castillo
reviews.comment: If you are visiting Dallas, Reunion Tower is a good place to take a pictures from the city. +9

reviews.name: Samuel Reed
reviews.comment: Families often visit here to relax and spend quality time together.

reviews.name: Andrew Boggs
reviews.comment: Nice little park with a cool fountain that would be perfect for eating lunch or reading a book however during the day it seems to be more of a hangout for the homeless.
